page.title: 19PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: In our area, there are six pubs. The Elephant and Castle and The Horseshoe were farms until the mid-19th century,but were changed when the Newcastle road (A52) became a main road. The White Hart, also on the A52, served as a mill before it was a pub. The Raven was purpose-built for the Brookhouse estate. The Cheshire Cheese and The Vine were built for local communities, but the estate near the Cheshire Cheese never materialised. The present owners put on musical entertainment each evening to attract customers, staying open till midnight on weekdays. For those interested in pool there is a Sunday-evening club at the Cheshire Cheese, and remote-control car enthusiasts should visit the Vine on a Sunday morning or Wednesday evening.
